intro: Ctenodon paucifoliolatus, commonly known as the sparse-leaf ctenodon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
